dublinCore.dc:title: 806 HR 7931 IH: WHO Withdrawal Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Biggs (for himself, Mr. Good of Virginia, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Norman, Mr. Gohmert, Mr. Massie, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Ms. Mace, Mr. Perry, Mr. Steube, Mrs. Boebert, Mrs. Greene of Georgia, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Gosar, Mrs. McClain, Mr. Allen, Mr. Roy, and Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the President to withdraw the United States from the Constitution of the World Health Organization, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the WHO Withdrawal Act.

section.header: Withdrawal of United States from the Constitution of the World Health Organization; prohibition on use of funds
section.text: Effective on the date of the enactment of this Act—

paragraph.text: the President shall withdraw the United States from the Constitution of the World Health Organization (62 Stat. 2679; 14 U.N.T.S 186); and
no funds available to any Federal department or agency may used to provide for the participation of the United States in the World Health Organization or any successor organization.

section.header: Repeal of the Act of June 14, 1948
section.text: The Act of June 14, 1948 (Public Law 806–43; 62 Stat. 441; 22 U.S.C. 290 et seq.), providing for membership and participation by the United States in the World Health Organization and authorizing an appropriation therefor, is repealed.
